intro: Biota chengii, commonly known as the Chinese sandmat, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically succulent and adapted to arid environments, which allows it to thrive in dry conditions. Biota chengii is often found in sandy or rocky soils in mountainous regions.
